text: You installed it locally right, imports don't work in hubl unless you have some kind of workflow setup to compile your assets

<@U04KG19KN0K> you could make sure that CSS file makes its way to your theme from node_modules, and then use require_css to pull it in where needed.  You could just copy the file over from node_modules to your CSS folder.

To maintain it you could also run add a postinstall script to your package.json that would copy this file for you every time you run npm install. This way when you update that package you will always have the latest CSS file.
Thanks, that makes sense! I'll probably copy it over every time `npm install` or `npm run` is ran.
